column1: #Text=[0045] For the process according to step (a) the alkalimetal hypochlorite and the alkalimetal hypohalite may be based on the same alkalimetal, or different alkalimetals, selected from lithium, sodium and potassium.
#Text=Sodium is the preferred alkalimetal for the oxidation process according to step (a).

#Text=[0046] The oxidation of the cellulose pulp according to step (a) is performed until at least 0.3 mmol carboxylic groups per gram cellulose pulp; and at least 0.1 mmol aldehyde groups per gram cellulose pulp are obtained.

#Text=[0047] Preferably, about 0.3 to 2.5 mmol carboxylic groups per gram cellulose pulp are obtained and about 0.1 to 5.0 mmol aldehyde groups per gram cellulose pulp are obtained during this process step.
#Text=For example the cellulose pulp may have about 0.5 to 2.2 mmol carboxylic groups per gram cellulose pulp.

#Text=For example, the cellulose may have about 0.2 mmol to 2.0 mmol aldehyde groups per gram cellulose pulp, another examples are about 0.2 mmol to 1.0 mmol aldehyde groups per gram cellulose pulp, and about 0.2 to 0.8 mmol aldehyde groups per gram cellulose pulp.
#Text=It shall be understood that the carboxylic groups may be transformed into carboxylate groups, and vice versa, depending on the surrounding pH.
#Text=[0048] The oxidation of the cellulose pulp as in step (a) may be further defined by the following steps, when a free radical reaction is used for the oxidation:
#Text=[0049] 1) providing a solution comprising an oxidising agent;
